context.introduction: Explore the essential tools of the Mexican kitchen! Learn about the traditional equipment that gives Mexican food its unique character.

sections.title: Molcajete: The Ancient Mortar
sections.content: The molcajete is a volcanic stone mortar used for over 6,000 years. It grinds spices and salsas, releasing essential oils and unique textures.

sections.title: Comal: The Flat Griddle
sections.content: A comal is a flat griddle made of clay or metal, used to cook tortillas, toast chiles, and roast vegetables. It is essential for authentic Mexican cooking.

sections.title: Traditional Tools
sections.content: Other important tools include the tortilla press and wooden spatula. Each tool has a special role in preparing classic dishes.

sections.title: Tips for Using Tools
listItems: Heat the comal well before use
Grind ingredients in the molcajete for best flavor
Use volcanic stone for authentic results
Keep tools clean and dry after use
